dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, you know, Facebook, um, always a hot topic, right? Especially with the election coming up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, you know, Facebook, um, always a hot topic, right? Especially with the election coming up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And it seems like they're finally, uh, doing *something* pretty big.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And it seems like they're finally, uh, doing something pretty big.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. This new "Voter Information Centre" they're launching, right? On Facebook and Instagram.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. This new Voter Information Centre they're launching, right? On Facebook and Instagram.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebookwhich has shied away from fact-checking President Trumps erroneous claims about mail-in votingis launching a voter information centre on the platform and on Instagram Thursday, in a bid to help at least 4 million Americans register to vote and to set the record straight on how to vote by mail

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. The big goal, like, is to help four million Americans register. But also, Host_A, it's about, you know, setting the record straight on mail-in voting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. The big goal, like, is to help four million Americans register. But also, Host_A, it's about, you know, setting the record straight on mail-in voting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebookwhich has shied away from fact-checking President Trumps erroneous claims about mail-in votingis launching a voter information centre on the platform and on Instagram Thursday, in a bid to help at least 4 million Americans register to vote and to set the record straight on how to vote by mail

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is so interesting because [overlaps] they've been, like, kinda hands-off with Trump's claims about mail-in voting fraud up until now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is so interesting because they've been, like, kinda hands-off with Trump's claims about mail-in voting fraud up until now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebookwhich has shied away from fact-checking President Trumps erroneous claims about mail-in voting... Up until now, Facebook had been adding labels to information about voting below such posts, including by Trumpa feature that was introduced in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Right? Yeah, it's a huge shift. And this centre, it's not just about registering. You can check if you're registered, uh, find out how to do it in your state.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Yeah, it's a huge shift. And this centre, it's not just about registering. You can check if you're registered, uh, find out how to do it in your state.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The voting centre is being done in partnership with the Bipartisan Policy Centre and will allow users to check whether they are registered to vote, while directing those who arent to information on registering in their state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and I heard they're trying to sign up poll workers too, which is, like, a big deal this year with COVID.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and I heard they're trying to sign up poll workers too, which is, like, a big deal this year with C O V I D.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The hub will also be used to sign up users as poll workersa position that is typically staffed by those aged over 60, but which has been understaffed this year because of the coronavirus risk, particularly among older people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! So many older volunteers, um, can't do it safely, so they need new blood, as it were.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! So many older volunteers, um, can't do it safely, so they need new blood, as it were.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The hub will also be used to sign up users as poll workersa position that is typically staffed by those aged over 60, but which has been understaffed this year because of the coronavirus risk, particularly among older people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But back to the mail-in voting thing. I mean, Trump and the Republicans have been, like, *really* pushing this idea that it's fraudulent. Even though, you know, experts keep debunking it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But back to the mail-in voting thing. I mean, Trump and the Republicans have been, like, really pushing this idea that it's fraudulent. Even though, you know, experts keep debunking it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The new feature comes after mail-in voting has been challenged by Trump and Republicans who claim that the practice, made more accessible this year to lower the risk of transmitting Covid-19 at polling stations, is fraudulent, despite experts debunking such claims.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And Zuckerberg, for so long, has been saying, "Oh, um, private companies shouldn't be the arbiters of truth."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And Zuckerberg, for so long, has been saying, Oh, um, private companies shouldn't be the arbiters of truth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The billionaire has defended his stance, saying private companies shouldnt be in a position to be the arbiter of the truth of everything that people say online.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which is kinda wild when you remember those reports that Facebook actually shielded conservative voices from fact-checking. Like, come on.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is kinda wild when you remember those reports that Facebook actually shielded conservative voices from fact-checking. Like, come on.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Despite this, investigations from Buzzfeed and NBC News revealed that Facebook executives shielded conservative voices, and media organizations from the site's fact-checking process.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Yeah, a bit contradictory, isn't it? He's definitely, um, under a lot of pressure, from his own staff too, about not taking action on Trump's posts.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a bit contradictory, isn't it? He's definitely, um, under a lot of pressure, from his own staff too, about not taking action on Trump's posts.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A battle with the White House over voting by mail would be unwelcome to Mark Zuckerberg who is already under pressure to address Facebook's role in spreading misinformation and Russian-backed propaganda in the 2016, while facing a backlash from his staff over failing to take actions on the President's false, and inflammatory posts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like they're trying to, uh, avoid Twitter's fate, you know? Remember when Twitter flagged Trump's tweets and then he went after them?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like they're trying to, uh, avoid Twitter's fate, you know? Remember when Twitter flagged Trump's tweets and then he went after them?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trumps grumbles on Twitter about mail-in voting were flagged by the platform in May with a note that read: Get the facts about mail-in ballots, prompting Trump to accuse the platform of trying to interfere in the election and silencing conservative voices.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, the executive order whole thing. So this is, like, a delicate dance for Facebook. But I guess they *have* to do something, especially with 76% of American voters eligible to vote by mail this year. That's, um, huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the executive order whole thing. So this is, like, a delicate dance for Facebook. But I guess they have to do something, especially with seventy six percent of American voters eligible to vote by mail this year. That's, um, huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Trump later signed an executive order aimed at curtailing immunity of Twitter, and that of other social media tech companies, from being sued over user content on their sites. BIG NUMBER 76%. Thats how many American voters are eligible to vote by mail, the largest figure in history, according to the New York Times.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That is a huge number. So it's, like, they're stepping in, but probably, uh, very carefully. We'll see how it plays out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is a huge number. So it's, like, they're stepping in, but probably, uh, very carefully. We'll see how it plays out.
